Fiduciary for my parents family trusts, overseeing residential and commercial properties, investments, accounting and tax reporting for four sub-trusts.

We provided two complete Hammond Organs with Leslie Speakers for all Blues Cruises departing from San Diego Bay from 2006 until 2011, after which time they ceased sailing from this port. My duties involved obtaining Transportation Worker Identification Credentials (TWIC) from the Department of Homeland Security to allow me to move equipment onto the cruise ship dock; moving the equipment through the security checkpoint for inspection; loading the equipment into baskets that get hoisted up to the Lido Deck by crane; setting up the rigs in the indoor theater and on the outdoor stage on the Lido Deck; sound check; on call for emergency repairs during the cruise; making sure I had enough parts and tools with me to repair 50+ year old stuff; enjoying the cabin, music, and food with my dear wife; tearing everything down on the last morning as we headed into the harbor; loading everything into baskets for the crane ride back down to the dock; getting the Jeep and trailer from the parking lot; waiting around for 45 minutes for one forklift operator to finish his or her break to move the baskets out to my trailer; giving up waiting and move my trailer into the warehouse so I can unload the baskets into the trailer and head for home.

Provided hardware and software and support for IBM 5110 5120 System/23 Datamaster systems in a National Users Group. Performed depot maintenance on a nationwide territory. Later provided migration solutions to PC platforms using PC51 emulation and Workstation BASIC for System/23 on PC. Took over legacy platforms of Libra Software for these systems, providing customer software support for Libra's CPA, Manufacturing, Job Cost, Construction, Distribution, and Property Management Accounting packages. Helped IBM Corporation by supporting legacy platforms directly from IBM's switchboard patching.

Elected to six consecutive one-year terms as volunteer Church Treasurer/CFO. Oversaw all accounting operations on a monthly basis. Signed checks. Responsible for $3+ Million annual budget. Reported to Business Committee and Church Board on monthly basis with complete financial reports. Served on pastoral search committee. Served on College Avenue Preschool committee. Oversaw changeover to new accounting system.

June 29, 2016, Andrew was a client of George Fish  /’s

George rescued a deeply troubled Leslie speaker cabinet I had found for my church's Hammond A-102 via Craigslist. Originally a mid-1960s model 147, it had been Frankensteined and MacGyvered until it was barely recognizable inside. George was able to diagnose the problem(s), rebuild the components - electrical and mechanical - and make it safe and reliable. Now it's one of the best 122/147s I've ever heard. Great communication, attention to detail, bedside manner, and excellent problem-solving skills are part of the the George Fish package. He's truly an amazing local resource.

Jeff and his son Ezra do great work on rebuilding old loudspeakers. They have reconed dozens of my vintage Jensen, Rola, Magnavox speakers from the Leslies that I service and rebuild in my business. Jeff is a fellow member of MITA International (Musical Instrument Technicians Association), and really knows his business. He services keyboards, rack gear, PA equipment, MIDI stuff, and who knows what else! by George Fish - Fish Organs - Authorized Hammond Dealer

summary: Hammond Organ Repairs & Maintenance of Hammond Organs and Leslie Speakers. Training apprentice Hammond Techs. Parts supplier for Vintage Hammond & Leslie products. Full rebuilding of these fine vintage instruments. fishorgans@aol.comSpecialties: Designing custom interfaces from Hammond Organs to Leslie Speaker cabinets. Providing parts kits and coaching for those wanting to repair their own Hammond Organ or Leslie Speaker.
